definitions: a person or thing that floats
an employee or worker who is not permanently assigned to a particular job or area
a small floating object or device
a speck in the field of vision caused by cells or cell fragments in the vitreous humor
examples: The leaf became a floater in the pond.
He's a floater, helping different departments when needed.
Use a floater to indicate where the fish are biting.
I noticed a floater in my right eye.
